questions.question_text: Which diagnostic command can you use to show the SD-WAN rules interface information and state?

discussion.content: For 7.0 it is actually "diagnose sys sdwan service". But C is correct, it shows the status.
B is correct because C only shows member information, but not related towards any service rule or the corresponding SLA.
6 and 40 are the same questions with different answers
page 73 of 7.0 study guide. answer is C
B correct

To check SD-WAN service rules status:

 Manual mode service rules.

 FGT # diagnose sys virtual-wan-link service

B is correct

Selected Answer: B
I think that is B. C (Member) informs only about interface but not status. B (Service) informs about service but interface and status too.

Selected Answer: C
answer is B, page 36.
Correct ans is C

Selected Answer: B
B refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 36
B, https://community.fortinet.com/t5/FortiGate/Technical-Tip-Diagnostic-commands-to-check-the-status-of-the-SD/ta-p/194246
C .page 36
I believe C is correct
I think the correct answer is B
Agreed , B and D are correct . page 52

Selected Answer: BD
BD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 52
Ans is BD

choices.C: All sessions are flushed by FortiGate after a policy change.
choices.B: Existing sessions remain unchanged after a policy change.
choices.A: The old sessions terminate after a policy change.
choices.D: FortiGate re-evaluates new sessions after a policy change.

comments.content: you can still enable your SDWAN after a static route so D is correct

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
AD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 150
Ans is D

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
Technically A is also correct as the exhibit is referencing a FortiManager. Page 150 6.4.5

choices.B: port1 is assigned a manual IP address.
choices.C: port1 and port2 are not administratively down.
choices.D: port1 is referenced in a firewall policy.
choices.A: port2 is referenced in a static route.

questions.question_text: Which CLI command do you use to perform real-time troubleshooting for ADVPN negotiation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 219
Correct ans is C
agreed , C is correct , page 218
I think correct answer is C

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Two hub-and-spoke groups are connected through a site-to-site IPsec VPN between Hub 1 and Hub 2. The administrator configured ADVPN on both hub-and- spoke groups.
If an ADVPN on-demand tunnel is established between Toronto and London, which two configuration settings are required for ADVPN to work? (Choose two.)

choices.D: On the spokes, auto-discovery-receiver is enabled on the IPsec VPN to the hub.
choices.A: On the hubs, auto-discovery-sender is enabled on the IPsec VPNs to spokes.
choices.C: On the hubs, tunnel-search is set selectors.
choices.B: auto-discovery-forwarder is enabled on all IPsec VPNs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
AD refer to SD-WAN_6.4_Study_Guide page 207
which ones are "the most true" answers ... and since forwarder are configured only on links between hubs (makes no sense towards spokes), then B is not correct.
A,D is correct.
I think correct ans is AD
I think the correct answer is A,D
